required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Novel Diet Approach to Combat Gestational Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Diet Approach to Combat Gestational Diabetes

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
There is an urgent need to implement novel diet approaches to combat the increasing rates of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM). The primary aim of this study is to establish the feasibility of time-restricted eating in pregnancy, to prepare for future larger controlled trials in this research project to determine the efficacy of time-restricted eating in women at risk of GDM. Expectations:
1. Women who have an increased risk of GDM will be able to adhere to time reduced eating during pregnancy.
2. Time reduced eating will improve short-term glycemic control in pregnancy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in average time-window for energy intake
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline (pre-intervention) time-window for energy intake to average time-window for energy intake during the 5-week intervention period
primary_outcome.description: Average daily time-window for energy intake will be registered through log books.

primary_outcome.measure: Weekly adherence rates for time restricted eating (TRE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly measures throughout the 5 week period of TRE intervention
primary_outcome.description: The number of days per week that the participants are able to adhere to TRE, as calculated as weekly average of days with a time-window ≤ 10 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived barriers to the protocol assessed with an unstructured interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly phone calls to participants in TRE group during the 5-week intervention period and after 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked about which barriers they perceived as challenging regarding keeping to a TRE schedule and if they have strategies to overcome these barriers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective appetite sensations assessed by Visual Analogue Scales
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once weekly throughout 6 weeks, on a weekday.
secondary_outcome.description: Paper line scales 100 mm on scales for Hunger ("How hungry are you": From "Not at all" = 0 on the scale to "Extremely. As hungry as I have ever felt" =100 on the scale, Fullness (From "Not at all" = 0 on the scale to "Extremely. As full as I have ever felt" = 100 on the scale, Satiety ("How satiated are you" From "Not at all" =0 on the scale to "Extremely" =100 on the scale, Desire to eat ("How strong is your desire to eat" From "Very weak. Extremely low" = 0 on the scale to "Very strong. Extremely high" = 100 on the scale and Prospective consumption (quantity) ("How much do you think you could (or would want to) eat right now?" From "Nothing at all" = 0 on the scale to "A very large amount" = 100 on the scale. Scales will be filled in in the morning, before dinner and at bedtime.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change between baseline and post-intervention in fasting glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Post-intervention fasting glucose minus pre-intervention fasting glucose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change between baseline and post-intervention in postprandial glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose levels 120 minutes after ingestion of 75 g glucose (oral glucose tolerance test)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change between baseline and post-intervention in fasting insulin
Change between baseline and post-intervention in postprandial insulin
secondary_outcome.description: Circulating insulin levels 120 minutes after ingestion of 75 g glucose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change between baseline and post-intervention blood pressure
Change between baseline and post-intervention body mass
Change between baseline and post-intervention fat mass
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass in kg and percent of body mass

secondary_outcome.measure: Change between baseline and post-intervention muscle mass
Change between baseline and post-intervention visceral fat area
secondary_outcome.description: Visceral fat area in squared cm.

arm_group.description: prolonging the duration of fasting between the last evening meal and the first meal of the next day
Standard care. Will receive a booklet about physical activity recommendations and healthy eating in pregnancy

intervention.description: Participants will attend a face-to-face meeting with the researchers at the last day of the first week of data collection (habitual diet and physical activity period) where they will be counselled to consume all food and fluid within a 8-10 h time window of their choice starting no later than 09.00 h for five weeks. During the intervention period, they will be counselled by weekly phone calls to provide encouragement, support and monitoring to improve adherence to the TRE window.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- carrying one singleton live foetus
- in pregnancy week 12-30
- having at least one risk factor for gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) according to Norwegian guidelines for GDM screening: pre-pregnancy BMI > 25 kg/m2, GDM in previous pregnancy, primiparae aged > 25 years, first degree relative with diabetes mellitus, Asian or African ethnicity, previous delivery of new-born > 4.5 kg
- understand written and spoken Norwegian language
Exclusion Criteria:
- habitual eating window < 12 hours

overall_official.affiliation: Department of circulation and medical imaging, NTNU
